description.narrative: The Solidarity Center assists in the creation, registration and expansion of trade unions in Honduras, particularly in the agriculture, apparel and construction sectors. The Solidarity Center builds the capacity of these unions to negotiate for worker rights—such as fair wages and safe working conditions—to improve the lives of Hondurans. The project provides training for local union leaders to make their unions self-sustainable; groundbreaking leadership training for women workers to advance within the labor movement; and a forum for women to advocate for gender equality and combat gender-based violence in the workplace.

The Solidarity Center provides rights education and skills training for workers in Honduras so they can form unions to protect their rights and bargain collectively to gain decent wages and safer workplaces. The Solidarity Center assists in the building and strengthening of labor organizations that demand justice for working people through effective legislation and legal proceedings. The project also links labor organizations with civil society groups to advocate for public policies that broaden protections for working people beyond the workplace.
